trans-unit.source: Pi estimator Hadoop sample in HDInsight | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Pi estimator Hadoop sample in HDInsight | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to run a Hadoop MapReduce sample Pi estimator on HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to run a Hadoop MapReduce sample Pi estimator on HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: This topic shows how to run a Hadoop MapReduce program in Azure HDInsight that estimates the value of the mathematical constant pi by using Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows how to run a Hadoop MapReduce program in Azure HDInsight that estimates the value of the mathematical constant pi by using Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: It also provides the Java code used in the MapReduce program used to estimate the value of pi for inspection.
trans-unit.target: It also provides the Java code used in the MapReduce program used to estimate the value of pi for inspection.

trans-unit.source: The steps in this document require a Windows-based HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: The steps in this document require a Windows-based HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: For information on running this and other samples with Linux-based clusters, see <linkText>Run the Hadoop samples in HDInsight</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For information on running this and other samples with Linux-based clusters, see <linkText>Run the Hadoop samples in HDInsight</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: The program uses a statistical (quasi-Monte Carlo) method to estimate the value of pi.
trans-unit.target: The program uses a statistical (quasi-Monte Carlo) method to estimate the value of pi.

trans-unit.source: Points placed at random inside of a unit square also fall within a circle inscribed within that square with a probability equal to the area of the circle, pi/4.
trans-unit.target: Points placed at random inside of a unit square also fall within a circle inscribed within that square with a probability equal to the area of the circle, pi/4.

trans-unit.source: The value of pi can be estimated from the value of 4R, where R is the ratio of the number of points that are inside the circle to the total number of points that are within the square.
trans-unit.target: The value of pi can be estimated from the value of 4R, where R is the ratio of the number of points that are inside the circle to the total number of points that are within the square.

trans-unit.source: The larger the sample of points used, the better the estimate is.
trans-unit.target: The larger the sample of points used, the better the estimate is.

trans-unit.source: The pi estimator Java code that contains the mapper and reducer functions is available for inspection below.
trans-unit.target: The pi estimator Java code that contains the mapper and reducer functions is available for inspection below.

trans-unit.source: The mapper program generates a specified number of points placed at random inside of a unit square and then counts the number of those points that are inside the circle.
trans-unit.target: The mapper program generates a specified number of points placed at random inside of a unit square and then counts the number of those points that are inside the circle.

trans-unit.source: The reducer program accumulates points counted by the mappers and then estimates the value of pi from the formula 4R, where R is the ratio of the number of points counted inside the circle to the total number of points that are within the square.
trans-unit.target: The reducer program accumulates points counted by the mappers and then estimates the value of pi from the formula 4R, where R is the ratio of the number of points counted inside the circle to the total number of points that are within the square.

trans-unit.source: The script provided for this sample submits a Hadoop jar job and is set up to run with a value 16 maps, each of which is required to compute 10 million sample points by the parameter values.
trans-unit.target: The script provided for this sample submits a Hadoop jar job and is set up to run with a value 16 maps, each of which is required to compute 10 million sample points by the parameter values.

trans-unit.source: These parameter values can be changed to improve the estimated value of pi.
trans-unit.target: These parameter values can be changed to improve the estimated value of pi.

trans-unit.source: For reference, the first 10 decimal places of pi are 3.1415926535.
trans-unit.target: For reference, the first 10 decimal places of pi are 3.1415926535.

trans-unit.source: The .jar file that contains the files needed by Hadoop on Azure to deploy the application is a .zip file and is available for download.
trans-unit.target: The .jar file that contains the files needed by Hadoop on Azure to deploy the application is a .zip file and is available for download.

trans-unit.source: You can unzip it with various compression utilities and then explore the files at your convenience.
trans-unit.target: You can unzip it with various compression utilities and then explore the files at your convenience.

trans-unit.source: The other samples that are available to help you get up to speed in using HDInsight to run MapReduce jobs are listed on <linkText>Running the HDInsight Samples[hdinsight-samples]</linkText><title></title>, along with links to instructions on how to run them.
trans-unit.target: The other samples that are available to help you get up to speed in using HDInsight to run MapReduce jobs are listed on <linkText>Running the HDInsight Samples[hdinsight-samples]</linkText><title></title>, along with links to instructions on how to run them.

trans-unit.source: You will learn:
trans-unit.target: You will learn:

trans-unit.source: How to use Azure PowerShell to run the pi estimator MapReduce program on Azure HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: How to use Azure PowerShell to run the pi estimator MapReduce program on Azure HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: What a MapReduce program written in Java looks like.
trans-unit.target: What a MapReduce program written in Java looks like.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites:
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites:

trans-unit.source: An Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: An Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Get Azure free trial</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Get Azure free trial</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: an HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: an HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: For instructions on the various ways in which such clusters can be created, see <linkText>Provision HDInsight Clusters</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For instructions on the various ways in which such clusters can be created, see <linkText>Provision HDInsight Clusters</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: A workstation with Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: A workstation with Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Install and use Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Install and use Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: To submit the MapReduce jobs
trans-unit.target: To submit the MapReduce jobs

trans-unit.source: Open Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: Open Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: For instructions on how to use the Azure PowerShell console window, see <linkText>Install and configure Azure PowerShell[powershell-install-configure]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For instructions on how to use the Azure PowerShell console window, see <linkText>Install and configure Azure PowerShell[powershell-install-configure]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Set the two variables in the following commands, and then run them:
trans-unit.target: Set the two variables in the following commands, and then run them:

trans-unit.source: Run the following command to create a MapReduce definition:
trans-unit.target: Run the following command to create a MapReduce definition:

trans-unit.source: The first argument indicates how many maps to create (default is 16).
trans-unit.target: The first argument indicates how many maps to create (default is 16).

trans-unit.source: The second argument indicates how many samples are generated per map (10 million by default).
trans-unit.target: The second argument indicates how many samples are generated per map (10 million by default).

trans-unit.source: So this program uses 10*10 million = 160 million random points to make its estimate of pi.
trans-unit.target: So this program uses 10*10 million = 160 million random points to make its estimate of pi.

trans-unit.source: The third argument indicates the location and name of the jar file used to run the sample on HDInsight 3.0 and 3.1 clusters.
trans-unit.target: The third argument indicates the location and name of the jar file used to run the sample on HDInsight 3.0 and 3.1 clusters.

trans-unit.target: (See below for the contents of this file.)

trans-unit.target: For comparison, the first 10 decimal places of pi are 3.1415926535.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you saw how to run a MapReduce job on HDInsight and how to use Monte Carlo methods that require and generate large data sets that can be managed by this service.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you saw how to run a MapReduce job on HDInsight and how to use Monte Carlo methods that require and generate large data sets that can be managed by this service.
